Unstable

Mina Protocol Unstable Debian Repository

Development builds and ad-hoc fixes for the Mina development team and external community testing.

⚠️

Critical Warning: Unstable Repository

This repository contains highly experimental packages for development and testing purposes only.

🚫 Production Risk

Not suitable for production environments. May cause system instability.

🔄 Volatile Channels

Channels are not guaranteed to be long-lived and may change without notice.

🐛 Experimental Code

Contains untested features, bugs, and breaking changes.

📞 Development Team

Always consult Mina Protocol development team for current information.

⚡ Use only in isolated testing environments with full understanding of risks ⚡

Supported Distributions

  • Ubuntu Focal (20.04 LTS)
  • Ubuntu Noble (24.04 LTS)
  • Debian Bullseye (11)
  • Debian Bookworm (12)

Available Packages

Package Network Debian Name
Mina Node Mainnet mina
Mina Rosetta Node Mainnet mina-rosetta
Archive Node Mainnet mina-archive
Archive Node Devnet mina-archive-devnet
Mina Node Devnet mina-devnet
Mina Rosetta Node Devnet mina-rosetta-devnet

Repository Purpose

Experimental package delivery for development, testing, and community validation of unstable Mina Protocol builds.

🔬

Development Testing

Internal development team validation and testing. Provides early access to experimental features, protocol changes, and critical patches before they mature into stable releases.

🧪 Experimental Features
Test cutting-edge protocol improvements and consensus mechanisms
🚑 Critical Patches
Ad-hoc fixes for urgent issues and security vulnerabilities
👥

Community Validation

External community testing and feedback collection. Enables advanced users and researchers to validate experimental features and provide crucial feedback for protocol development.

🔍 Pre-release Validation
Community testing before promotion to beta or stable channels
💻 Development Environment
Setup isolated testing environments for advanced development work

📢 Important Notice

Channels and packages in this repository are not guaranteed to be long-lived and may change or be removed without notice.

Always consult the Mina Protocol development team for the most current information about available channels, package compatibility, and recommended usage patterns.

Debian Installation Guide

To install Mina unstable packages through the APT repository, follow these steps:

1Install Dependencies (Optional)

Install required dependencies if not already present:

apt-get install -y lsb-release ca-certificates wget gnupg

Update package cache:

apt-get update

2Import Repository Signing Key

Download and install the Mina repository signing key:

wget -q https://unstable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com/repo-signing-key.gpg -O /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/minaprotocol.gpg

Update package cache after adding the key:

apt-get update

3Add Mina APT Repository

Add the Mina unstable APT repository:

echo "deb https://unstable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com bullseye unstable" > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.list
Distribution Codenames: Replace bullseye with your distribution codename.

Auto-detect your codename:
lsb_release -c
Or use these common codenames:
  • Ubuntu 20.04: focal
  • Ubuntu 24.04: noble
  • Debian 11: bullseye
  • Debian 12: bookworm

4Install Mina Package

Update package list and install Mina:

apt-get update
apt-get install -y mina
Package Selection: Replace mina with the appropriate package name from the table above (e.g., mina-devnet, mina-archive, mina-rosetta, etc.).

⚠️ Warning: Unstable packages are experimental and may cause system instability. Only install on development or testing systems.
